    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    long
    getLockedBuffer()
    Queries the pointer returned by the previous GpuBuffer.lock(int, int) if GpuBuffer.isLocked() returns true, otherwise the pointer is invalid, this is mostly used for validation.
    boolean
    isLocked()
    Queries whether the buffer has been locked by GpuBuffer.lock(int, int), this is mostly used for validation.

    • onDiscard

      protected void onDiscard()
      Description copied from class: GpuResource
      Subclass should override this method to invalidate any internal handles, etc. to backend API resources. This may be called when the underlying 3D context is no longer valid and so no backend API calls should be made.
      Specified by:
      onDiscard in class GpuResource

    • isLocked

      public boolean isLocked()
      Description copied from class: GpuBuffer
      Queries whether the buffer has been locked by GpuBuffer.lock(int, int), this is mostly used for validation.
      Specified by:
      isLocked in class GpuBuffer
      Returns:
      true if the buffer is locked, false otherwise.

    • getLockedBuffer

      public long getLockedBuffer()
      Description copied from class: GpuBuffer
      Queries the pointer returned by the previous GpuBuffer.lock(int, int) if GpuBuffer.isLocked() returns true, otherwise the pointer is invalid, this is mostly used for validation.
      Specified by:
      getLockedBuffer in class GpuBuffer
      Returns:
      the pointer to the locked buffer if locked.
